Articles.Content: I just saw a funny Reddit post where someone made a hanging monorail in KSP1, and then it hit me:  if KSP2 is going to put more emphasis on base-building, wouldn't it make sense to have trains/trams that can transport raw materials and Kerbals to different places around a celestial body?  Say, if there is a big vein of some valuable material, you could run a rail from your base out to a mining outpost.  Another idea would be to have your spaceport a little ways from your base to avoid any damage to your base from incoming or outgoing craft.  Anyone know if there's been talk about this?  I did a brief search through the forums and didn't see anything.

27 minutes ago, sciencecompliance said:

trains/trams that can transport raw materials and Kerbals to different places around a celestial body? 

Yes. Hanging monorail tracks would be good, with them just costing power, (I think that’s how that works) and some metal. My idea was for the train part to be more expensive. You could also use ground rails. I put this in my thread, KSP 2 ideas that do t merit their own thread. But now that this idea has its own thread, we could go into more detail of the idea.

Edited January 31, 2022 by Admiral Fluffy
I'll try to build a monorail in KSP1 in a few months, what is the part with the best length/width ratio?
